ResearchProjectDef.label: glyph deciphering
ResearchProjectDef.description: The glyphs both engraved on stargates and on mysterious scraps of paper have meaning. Deciphering them and locating where they go may unlock a new way of travel.

ResearchProjectDef.label: makeshift stargate creation
ResearchProjectDef.description: The materials used to build the ancient stargates aren't available on this planet, but we might be able to create a makeshift version.

ResearchProjectDef.label: advanced stargate creation
ResearchProjectDef.description: By further studying the design of the original stargate, we could create a much better replica using the materials available on the planet.

ResearchProjectDef.label: plasteel alloys
ResearchProjectDef.description: A material with incredible strength can made by combining Plasteel, Uranium and Steel. Even though it is too atomically unstable to use as a building material, its low-friction nature could be used to make an aperture to cover a stargate.

ResearchProjectDef.label: irises
ResearchProjectDef.description: Experimentation reveals that a barrier placed microns from the event horizon of a stargate would stop almost anything from reintegrating. Using the low-friction alloy we discovered, we could make an aperture to cover the stargate and prevent people invading our base through it. Make the installation kit at a fabrication bench.
